chapter.title: Traffic visualization overview
chapter.para: This is an overview over the 3D visualization widgets which are used to represent a map

As everyone can see the main class is represented by the TRAFFIC_3D_MAP_WIDGET. In general, per map element type (e.g. place, line section, road, traveler) a corresponding object exists at runtime that controls the display of all the map elements of this type, e.g. TRAFFIC_3D_PLACE_REPRESENTATION, TRAFFIC_3D_CONNECTION_REPRESENTATION, and TRAFFIC_3D_TRAVELER_REPRESENTATION. All of the representation classes use factories that are responsible for the generation of 3d visualization objects for a single map element (e.g. TRAFFIC_3D_PLACE_SQUARE_REP_FACTORY). To change the look of an element the factory can be exchanged. Most of the shown classes use shared constants and functions from class TRAFFIC_3D_CONSTANTS.
